# Other Revenue Sources
•	I want you to understand the difference between user charges and license fees:
o	User charges: Purchasing a government service or good
o	License fee: Purchasing the right to engage in a regulated activity (e.g., driving, hunting, selling alcohol, etc). 
•	Price discrimination based on 
o	Group: Pricing based on various characteristics of the consumers, e.g., seniors, students, etc. to encourage 
o	Location: Different charges for in-state/county or out-of-state/county residents
	Example: Lower price to enter Eagle Creek Park if residing in Marion County.
•	Equity issues:
o	User charges usually do not take into account income and everyone pays the same charge (except in the case of price discrimination) and thus, user charges are regressive.
